documentation.text:
The swapper router handles the swapping from one token to another.
 By default it does all swaps through WETH, in two steps checking which DEX is better for each stage of the swap.
 It also supports ETH in or out and handles it by converting to WETH and back.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,address[] memory) view external returns (uint256[] memory)

getAmountOut(address,address,uint256).details: In the case where a custom swapper is used, return value may not be precise.
getAmountOut(address,address,uint256).notice: Gets the amount of toToken received by swapping amountIn of fromToken.

params.amountIn_: The amount of fromToken being swapped.

returns.amountOut: The amount of toToken received by swapping amountIn of fromToken.

setCurvePool(address,address).details: To use Uniswap or Sushiswap instead, set the Curve Pool to the zero address.
setCurvePool(address,address).notice: Sets the Curve Pool to use for swapping a token with WETH.

params.curvePool_: The address of the Curve Pool.
params.token_: The token to set the Curve Pool for.

setSlippageTolerance(uint256).details: Stored as a multiplier, e.g. 2% would be set as 0.98.

swap(address,address,uint256).notice: Swaps an amount of fromToken to toToken.

params.amountIn_: The amount of fromToken to swap for toToken.

swapAll(address,address).notice: Swaps all of the users balance of fromToken for toToken.

natspec.notice: The swapper router handles the swapping from one token to another. By default it does all swaps through WETH, in two steps checking which DEX is better for each stage of the swap. It also supports ETH in or out and handles it by converting to WETH and back.
